page.title: 13 COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Residents of Binfield Heath have been without a public 'phone box in the village for the past month and will only shortly be getting a replacement. The kiosk which used to stand just outside the village's post office and stores was rermoved and its replacement in a new position has been delayed because British Telecom sought permission from the wrong authorities. The saga about three years ago when Telecom took over the responsibility of call boxes from the GPO. The Binfield Heath box which stood on the forecourt of the post office, had been looked after for the past 19 years by Mr. Ern Tester, the sub-postmaster, and he had recieved an annual remuneration for the duty. He said "One day I got this letter from British Telecom telling me that the arangement was to stop- they ...
